com.example.rest

Class PhoneNumberRest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.rest.PhoneNumberRest

  • @Path(value="/phonenumber")
public class PhoneNumberRest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will respond to request involved in handling information of a single phone number. The url path to this REST API is:
    http://localhost:8080/jeer/rest/phonenumber

    • Method Detail

      • addPhoneNumber

        @POST
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public Response addPhoneNumber(com.example.entity.PhoneNumber number,
                                             @QueryParam(value="personId")
                                             java.lang.String pid)
        This will respond to POST request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
        Will create a new phone number for a person.
        Parameters:
        number - A json string that is mapped to the specified entity (with @XmlRootElement)
        Returns:
        A Response object stating how things went

      • deleteNumber

        @DELETE
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public Response deleteNumber(@QueryParam(value="numberId")
                                             java.lang.String numberId)
        This will respond to DELETE request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
        Get a single person with all necessary details if the person with the given id exists in the database. If the id is less than zero (< 0), an empty person is returned simply providing the json structure used.
        Parameters:
        personId - The id of the person to get. Use negative value to get empty structure
        Returns:
        A Response object, having the person as a 'payload'

      • getNumberTypes

        @GET
@Consumes(value="text/plain")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public Response getNumberTypes()
        This will respond to GET request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "text/plain".
        Returns:
        A Response object stating how things went
